intro: Nephralles, commonly known as the kidney bean plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods containing edible seeds, which are widely used in culinary applications. Nephralles thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it both an ornamental and a valuable agricultural crop.
